Sentencas: The current literature on solid oxide fuel cell and internal combustion engine (SOFC-ICE) integration is focused on the application of advanced combustion technologies operating as bottoming cycles to generate a small load share.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and internal combustion engine for maritime applications

Sentencas: This integration approach can pose challenges for ships such as restricted dynamic capabilities and large space and weight requirements.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and internal combustion engine for maritime applications

Sentencas: Furthermore, the potential of SOFC-ICE integration for marine power generation has not been explored.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and internal combustion engine for maritime applications

Sentencas: Consequently, the current work proposes a novel approach of SOFC-ICE integration for maritime applications, which allows for high-efficiency power generation while the SOFC anode-off gas (AOG) is blended with natural gas (NG) and combusted in a marine spark-ignited (SI) engine for combined power gen-eration.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and internal combustion engine for maritime applications

Sentencas: The objective of this paper is to investigate the potential of the proposed SOFC-ICE integration approach with respect to system efficiency, emissions, load sharing, space and weight considerations and load response.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and internal combustion engine for maritime applications

Sentencas: In this work, a verified zero-dimensional (0-D) SOFC model, engine experiments and a validated AOG-NG mean value engine model is used.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and internal combustion engine for maritime applications

Sentencas: The study found that the SOFC-ICE integration, with a 67-33 power split at 750 kWe power output, yielded the highest efficiency improvement of 8.3% over a conventional marine natural gas engine.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and internal combustion engine for maritime applications

Sentencas: Simulation results showed that promising improvements in efficiency of 5.2%, UHC and NOx reductions of about 30% and CO2 reductions of about 12% can be achieved from a 33-67 SOFC-ICE power split with comparatively much smaller increments in size and weight of 1.7 times.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and internal combustion engine for maritime applications

Sentencas: Furthermore, the study concluded that in the proposed SOFC-ICE system for maritime applications, a power split that favours the ICE would significantly improve the dynamic capabilities of the combined system and that the possible sudden and large load changes can be met by the ICE.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and internal combustion engine for maritime applications
